comment._content:
i gather this is site of now 1 o connell street office tower.
what a great old bldg.

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: news.google.com/newspapers?id=-WxVAAAAIBAJ&sjid=UpUDA... Same place different day! Also includes a pic of the previous occupant. news.google.com/newspapers?id=4DhVAAAAIBAJ&sjid=6ZQDA... - different day again! Looks like they hadn't yet put the flagpole up in this Sydney Mail pic...a coupe of other things don't match the PHM pic...a tele pole near the corner appears to have been added...I wonder what became of the Tasmanian blackwood staircase (!) ...the Sydney Mail pics are by Henry King...

comment.author: 28307887@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Your notes suggest building started in 1824, yet photo has a date of 1720, has someone in archives added this date to the glass plate in error?

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/palmypaul] No those 1720 numbers are the photographer's plate numbers - all very confusing.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02]  The Sydney Mail article is a great find and dates  this photo to >1905.  Henry King had sold out to Charles Kerry by then and was working with/for him (acccording to PhM blurbs).  This photo and the landscape version are a little later due to the tramway pole;  the landscape one even has a motor car [*gasp!*].

comment.author: 28307887@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Thank you, yes I now understand the plate numbers, great history there, thanks for the information, fantastic set of photo's
